alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 21 at 2:48AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall over recent wildfire burn scars is possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following areas, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. This includes the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar area. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff over the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar may result in flooding of nearby rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Areas impacted by the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar continue to remain highly vulnerable to runoff, as soils are still unable to adequately absorb rainfall. This leads to an increased threat for flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
